thing-type.label: ZSE40 v2 4-in-1 Sensor
thing-type.description: 4-in-1 Sensor<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<ul&gt<li&gt4 smart sensors in 1 compact device</li&gt <li&gt7 levels of motion sensitivity to choose from</li&gt <li&gt3 modes for motion / temp led indicator notifications</li&gt <li&gtBuilt-in tamper protection</li&gt <li&gtLow battery alerts</li&gt <li&gtZ-Wave Plus with improved 500 chip for faster and safer wireless communication</li&gt <li&gtSecurity enabled Z-Wave device with AES signal encryption</li&gt </ul&gt<p&gt<strong&gtFactory Reset</strong&gt</p&gt <p&gtIf your primary controller is missing or inoperable, you may need to reset the device to factory settings. To complete the reset process manually, remove the back cover to trigger tamper switch. Press and release the Z-Wave button 10 TIMES quickly (within 10 seconds).</p&gt <p&gtNOTE: All previously recorded activity and custom settings will be erased from the device’s memory.</p&gt <br /&gt<h2&gtInclusion Information</h2&gt<ol&gt<li&gtInstall the batteries and bring the 4-in-1 sensor as close to your Z-Wave gateway controller as possible</li&gt <li&gtPut your Z-Wave controller in inclusion mode</li&gt <li&gtPress and release the Z-Wave button TWICE quickly. The sensor will enter secure inclusion mode.</li&gt <li&gtA new 4-in-1 sensor should appear on your controller’s device list</li&gt </ol&gt<p&gtQ: I have not been able to add the device to my network after several attempts, what do I do now?</p&gt <p&gtA: If you are unable to include the Z-Wave sensor to your controller, please try one of the following:</p&gt <ul&gt<li&gtBring the 4-in-1 sensor closer to your Z-Wave controller</li&gt <li&gtPress and release the Z-Wave button quickly several times once you put the controller in the inclusion mode to ensure the command has gone through</li&gt <li&gtPut your controller in the EXCLUSION mode and press and release the Z-Wave button, then try adding it to your network again</li&gt </ul&gt<p&gt<strong&gtInitialization/Inclusion Issues</strong&gt</p&gt <p&gtIf the unit does not initialize on initial inclusion (i.e., appears to be an unknown device), ask openHAB 2 to reinitialize the device (e.g., in PaperUI, via Configuration > Things > [Name] > Edit) and immediately press the Z-Wave button on the unit (e.g., right after saving your changes in PaperUI).</p&gt <br /&gt<h2&gtExclusion Information</h2&gt<ol&gt<li&gtBring the 4-in-1 sensor as close to your Z-Wave gateway controller as possible</li&gt <li&gtPut your Z-Wave controller in exclusion mode</li&gt <li&gtPress and release the Z-Wave button TWICE quickly</li&gt <li&gtThe device should disappear from your controller’s device list.</li&gt </ol&gt<p&gtThe led indicator will flash 3 times when you take the batteries out and put them back in to indicate the device has been successfully excluded. Please repeat the process following all steps carefully if the led indicator blinks only once when you re-insert the batteries</p&gt <br /&gt<h2&gtWakeup Information</h2&gt<p&gtUse the Wake Up command to set wake-up interval for the sensor (from 10 minutes to 1 week) to report back to the controller. You can also press and release the Z-Wave button once to wake the device up manually.</p&gt

parameter.name: config_2_1
parameter.label: 2: Temperature Sensitivity
parameter.description: Amount the temperature must change before a report is sent<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtUse this setting to set a range for how much the temperature needs to change for it to be reported by the sensor</p&gt <p&gtValues: 1 - 50. Values are in 1/10 of a degree C, so 1 is 0.1 degree and 50 is 5 degrees.</p&gt <p&gtDefault: 10 (1 degree). The sensor will report the new temperature value to the controller whenever the temperature goes up or down by 1 degree.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_3_1
parameter.label: 3: Humidity
parameter.description: Configure Relative Humidity<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtUse it to set humidity percentage change to be reported by the sensor. Values: 1 - 50 where 1 stands for 1% and 50 stands for 50%. Default set to 10%.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_4_1
parameter.label: 4: Light Sensor
parameter.description: Configure Light Sensor<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtReports light level in percentage (1-100). Use it to choose light percentage change to be reported by the sensor. Values: 5 - 50 where 5 stands for 5% and 50 stands for 50%. Default set to 10%. </p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_5_1
parameter.label: 5: Trigger Interval
parameter.description: Set the trigger interval for motion sensor re-activation.<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtUse it to set trigger interval - the time when motion is reported again after initial trigger. Values: 15 - 255 where 1 stands for 1 second and 255 stands for 255 seconds. Default set to 15 seconds. NOTE: Small interval will increase activity and decrease battery life. </p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_6_1
parameter.label: 6: Motion Sensor Sensitivity
parameter.description: Adjust sensitivity of the motion sensor.

parameter.name: config_7_1
parameter.label: 7: LED indicator mode
parameter.description: Select the LED indicator mode<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtLED indicator will flash every 3 minutes or whenever you press the Z-Wave button to indicate temperature level.</p&gt <p&gtGreen = under 60°F</p&gt <p&gtBlue = 60°-75°F</p&gt <p&gtYellow = 75°-83°F</p&gt <p&gtPurple = 83°-97°F</p&gt <p&gtRed = over 97°F / motion detected / tamper switch triggered </p&gt <p&gtNOTE: Mode 2 will increase activity and decrease battery life</p&gt</p&gt
